en: Canst thou draw out leviathan with a fishhook? Or press down his tongue with a cord?
hmr: “Leviathan chu ngakuoiin i hnûk dawk thei ding am a nih? Annawleh, a lei chu hruiin i keihnuoi zo ding am a nih?

en: Canst thou put a rope into his nose? Or pierce his jaw through with a hook?
hmr: A hnâr chu hruihruolin i khit thei ding am a nih? Annawleh, a khâk chu thalin i suntlang thei ding am a nih?

en: Will he make many supplications unto thee? Or will he speak soft words unto thee?
hmr: I kuoma chun hninahai tamtak siemin, I kuoma chun thu innêmhai chu a hril ding am a nih?

en: Will he make a covenant with thee, That thou shouldest take him for a servant for ever?
hmr: Ama chu siehlawa kumkhuoa i nei zingna dingin, I kuoma chun thutiem a siem ding am a nih?

en: Wilt thou play with him as with a bird? Or wilt thou bind him for thy maidens?
hmr: Vate inhnelpui angin ama chu în hnelpui ding am a nih? Annawleh, i rawngbâwltunu ta dingin ama chu i khit ding am a nih?

en: Will the bands of fishermen make traffic of him? Will they part him among the merchants?
hmr: Ngamantuhai chun innêpnain an hmang ding am a nih? Sumdâwng mihai lai chun ama chu an sem dar dîm a nih?

en: Canst thou fill his skin with barbed irons, Or his head with fish-spears?
hmr: A vun chu thîr kibar neiin i suksip thei ding am a nih? Annawleh, a lu chu ngakhâwfeihaiin?

en: Lay thy hand upon him; Remember the battle, and do so no more.
hmr: Ama chunga chun i kut hei inlet hrim la. In inthaw dân chu hre zing i ta, Thaw nâwk ta ngai naw ti nih.

en: Behold, the hope of him is in vain: Will not one be cast down even at the sight of him?
hmr: Ngai ta, ama hne în zuomna chu a thlâwn el a na, Ama hei hmu ngawt khawmin mi chu a beidawng nghâl el a nih.

en: None is so fierce that he dare stir him up; Who then is he that can stand before me?
hmr: Ama suktho ding khawpa huoisen tukhawm an um nawh a, Chuong a ni chun tu am keia hmaa ngir thei ding?

en: Who hath first given unto me, that I should repay him? Whatsoever is under the whole heaven is mine.
hmr: Ama ka pêk kîr nâwk dingin tuin am ka kuomah an pêk hmasa hlak a? Iengkim vânkhuphnuoia thil taphawt chu ka ta a nih.

en: I will not keep silence concerning his limbs, Nor his mighty strength, nor his goodly frame.
hmr: A kehai hrâtzie chu hril thei bâk a nih, A tha hrâtzie a taksa muk ṭhat dân khawm chu.

en: Who can strip off his outer garment? Who shall come within his jaws?
hmr: A silfên chunghnung chu tuin am hâwk ngam a ta? Tuin am thîrse thuo hni hung insêdetir thei a ta?

en: Who can open the doors of his face? Round about his teeth is terror.
hmr: Tu am a khâk chela a bau keika thei ding? A ha intlar kuol ṭhut chu ṭi a um sih a.

en: His strong scales are his pride, Shut up together as with a close seal.
hmr: A vun char inuoi chu a suong tak a na, Chârde ang ela khawng rût chu,

en: One is so near to another, That no air can come between them.
hmr: Pakhat chun a dang a hnai hleh a, A kâra chun boruok hrim a lût dêr nawh.

en: They are joined one to another; They stick together, so that they cannot be sundered.
hmr: An inṭingmat tuo tlat a, Kei ṭhe thei ruol a ni nawh.

en: His sneezings flash forth light, And his eyes are like the eyelids of the morning.
hmr: Ân simhai chun var a suksuok a, A mithai chu vârṭien var ang el a nih.

en: Out of his mouth go burning torches, And sparks of fire leap forth.
hmr: A baua inthawk chun meiser chawklaihai a suok a, Meisihai chu a vuong suok bawk a.

en: Out of his nostrils a smoke goeth, As of a boiling pot and burning rushes.
hmr: A hnârkuoa inthawkin meikhu a suok a, Thil suongna bêl le hlobuk kâng ang elin.

en: His breath kindleth coals, And a flame goeth forth from his mouth.
hmr: A thuok chun meilinghai chu a mûtchawk a, A baua inthawk chun meichawk a suok a.

en: In his neck abideth strength, And terror danceth before him.
hmr: A rînga chun hrâtna a um a, A hmaa chun ṭiumna chu a lâm a.

en: The flakes of his flesh are joined together: They are firm upon him; they cannot be moved.
hmr: A tisa hlawmhai chu ân zawm khâwm tlat a, A chunga chun ân nghat tlat a,sukchâng ruol an ni nawh.

en: His heart is as firm as a stone; Yea, firm as the nether millstone.
hmr: A lung chu lung anga ngar a na, Anih, bu râwtna lung hnuoihnung ang elin.

en: When he raiseth himself up, the mighty are afraid: By reason of consternation they are beside themselves.
hmr: Ama chu a hung tho pha chun, mi hrâthai chu an ṭih a: Ṭitna leiin anni chu an inhâwrkhâwm a.

en: If one lay at him with the sword, it cannot avail; Nor the spear, the dart, nor the pointed shaft.
hmr: Miin kâwlhnâmin sât sien khawm sât pawp naw nih, Annawleh, fei khawmin, thal khawmin, hmawlzum khawmin sun pawp naw nih.

en: He counteth iron as straw, And brass as rotten wood.
hmr: Thîr chu bupâwl angin a ngai a, Dârsen chu thing hmawn angin.

en: The arrow cannot make him flee: Sling-stones are turned with him into stubble.
hmr: Thalhai chun ama chu a suktlân thei nawh a, Saihlumhai khawm chu ama kuoma chun pâwlbul ang a nih.

en: Clubs are counted as stubble: He laugheth at the rushing of the javelin.
hmr: Hmawlzumhai khawm chu pâwlbul ang chaua ngai a na, Fei inlap zawk zawkhai khawm chu a nuisan a.

en: His underparts are like sharp potsherds: He spreadeth as it were a threshing-wain upon the mire.
hmr: A hnuoihrût tieng chu bekawihâr ngei ang an na, Dûm chirdiek chu buchilna hrizâwl angin a hrût cham duoi a;

en: He maketh the deep to boil like a pot: He maketh the sea like a pot of ointment.
hmr: Li inthûk chu bêl angin ân phultir a, Tuisuoriet chu thilhnâk angin a siem hlak.

en: He maketh a path to shine after him; One would think the deep to be hoary.
hmr: A hnunga chun a fêna lampui chu a sukhuom vâr a, Li inthûk chu mi chun hmul vâr amani a sâwn rau khawpin.

en: Upon earth there is not his like, That is made without fear.
hmr: Hnuoi chunga hin ama ang an um nawh a, Ṭitna nei loa siem chu.

en: He beholdeth everything that is high: He is king over all the sons of pride.
hmr: Thil insâng tinrêng chu a hmuh a, Chapona naupahai po po chunga lal a nih,” tiin.
